word: Have you not been reaching out and purchasing property? And yet now, just now, is the time when the work must be carried on in our cities. Greater New York is to be worked. But it costs something to carry forward the work in a large city. Do you not feel it your privilege to give something to advance the work in New York City?--Letter 6, 1902, p. 1. (To Gilbert Collins, Jan. 3, 1902)
